pt.ist.fenixframework

Class DomainFenixFrameworkRoot

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ist.fenixframework.core.AbstractDomainObject
      • pt.ist.fenixframework.DomainFenixFrameworkRoot_Base
        • pt.ist.fenixframework.DomainFenixFrameworkRoot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, DomainObject

    public class DomainFenixFrameworkRoot
extends DomainFenixFrameworkRoot_Base
    The DomainFenixFrameworkRoot is a singleton root object that is related to all the DomainMetaClasses in the system.
    The initialize method is called during the initialization of the FenixFramework. This method is responsible for the initialization of the DomainMetaClasses, and the DomainConsistencyPredicates. It creates the persistent versions of new domain classes and predicates that have been detected in the code, and deletes old ones that have been removed.
    Author:
    Jo√£o Neves - JoaoRoxoNeves@ist.utl.pt

      • initialize

        public void initialize(DomainModel domainModel)
        Entry point of the initialization of the DomainFenixFrameworkRoot, which initializes the DomainMetaClasses and the DomainConsistencyPredicates. If the framework was configured not to create meta objects, it deletes all DomainMetaClasses and DomainConsistencyPredicates instead.

        public static void checkpointTransaction()
        Commits the current, and starts a new write transaction.
